On 4/4/07, Alexandru Popescu =E2=98=80 <the.mindstorm.mailinglist@...=
> wrote:

> [...] exceptions thrown from the constructor
> will prevent the=
 individual test method from being reported, while
> exceptions thrown from=
 setUp() are treated as test errors.


That's only applicable to JUnit 3.8,=
 and I did word it badly originally.
Exceptions thrown from the constructor=
 will indicate a problem with the
class--I made it sound in the above like =
the problem would be silently
swallowed, which is not true.  Thanks,

   Da=
vid Saff
